entry.title: Re: RPA 48M and 48K deprecated
entry.content: Yes you are right. 48M & 48K RPA packages are deprecated. Instead, you can try with standard API API_PURCHASEREQUISITION_PROCESS_SRV for Purchase Requisitions. For mass confirmation of Production Orders, to my knowledge, there is no standard API but you can explore custom automation using SAP Build Process Automation or external RPA tools. Check CDS View I_POSupplierConfirmationAPI01 to retrieve confirmation data

entry.title: Sales in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
Welcome to your one-stop shop to learn and share knowledge about SAP's ready-to-run public Cloud ERP software solution.  

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition is part of SAP Business Suite that brings AI, data, and applications together into a fully integrated system. This community is open for anyone in the Cloud ERP ecosystem–customers, partners, and SAP experts. 

This blog shares highlights on Sales in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508.

  • Advanced down payment processing for delivery-related scenarios
  • Flexible Account Determination for Reconciliation and Cash Settlement
  • Display and edit of price elements in Manage Preliminary Billing Documents - Services app
  • Returns Order OData v4 API: enhancements such as creation with reference and creation for advanced variant configuration
  • Customer returns for sales kits with warehouse management
  • Managing Price Agreements in Sales Contracts - 2508 Scope
  • Debit Memo Request OData V4 API - create without reference, initial scope to include pricing elements, partner entities, and more
  • Creation and editing of sales orders without charge with the Fiori app 'Manage Sales Orders Without Charge - Version 2'
  • Credit memo requests and debit memo requests with variant configuration (single material)
  • Cloud BAdI to modify sales document data in finalize phase before save
  • CDS view and API for material listing and exclusion
  • Integration of payment by link in sales billing (Release 2502.1)
  • Handling expiring prices with Joule (Release 2502.2)
  • Creation of customer invoice before posting of goods issue (Release 2502.2)
  • Joule: AI-assisted sales order status check (Release 2502.3)

Watch my video to get a glimpse of the new features:

 

 

Advanced down payment processing for delivery-related scenarios

Advanced down payment processing for delivery-related scenarios allows businesses to efficiently manage customer down payments with reference to outbound deliveries, using rule-based determination to address diverse business needs.

This feature delivers tangible financial and operational benefits by reducing exposure to credit risk and helping maintain strong liquidity through upfront collections tied directly to deliveries. It increases accuracy, transparency, and flexibility in how down payments are settled, enabling businesses to clear exactly the right amounts at the desired level of granularity. Preconfigured logistics-focused content accelerates time to value while remaining easy to tailor to specific policies and processes. A streamlined, intuitive user experience guides users step by step and surfaces detailed information throughout, improving control, auditability, and user productivity.

It provides a robust, rules-driven framework for managing down payments in delivery-related scenarios. Businesses can initiate and process customer down payments with explicit reference to outbound deliveries, apply rule-based determination to select the appropriate process variant for diverse requirements, and orchestrate execution through the billing plan. Settlement leverages the condition technique, providing powerful flexibility to calculate, allocate, and reconcile down payments precisely as needed across different delivery and billing contexts.

We will explain this feature in detail in the upcoming SAP S/4HANA Product Expert Training  Please register for the Sales session. The session is open to SAP Partners. 

Figure: Advanced down payment processing for delivery-related scenarios

Figure: Advanced down payment processing for delivery-related scenarios

 

Flexible Account Determination for Reconciliation and Cash Settlement

This feature provides the flexibility to tailor general ledger (G/L) account determination to meet specific country or industry standards, ensuring accurate financial postings. By automating complex reconciliation and cash settlement processes, it significantly reduces manual labor, leading to cost savings and scalability as business needs evolve.

This feature delivers significant operational efficiency and cost savings by automating the complex process of general ledger account determination for different countries and industries. By eliminating the need for extensive manual labor in billing, clerks, and accountants, organizations can achieve substantial reductions in labor costs while improving scalability as their business evolves. The flexibility to customize account determination based on specific country or industry standards ensures accurate financial postings and regulatory compliance, while the automation of reconciliation and cash settlement processes reduces human error and accelerates financial operations.

The feature enables organizations to set up configurable condition tables with both predefined standard fields and custom fields to tailor general ledger account determination to their specific requirements. Users can post billing documents to alternative reconciliation accounts or directly to cash accounts based on these configurable conditions, ensuring accurate posting to the correct financial accounts. The system supports the creation of custom fields to accommodate new product lines, business locations, or accounting practices without requiring a complete system overhaul, and allows modification of existing determination tables as business needs change and evolve.

Watch this demo to have a complete view of the feature.

 

Demo: Flexible Account Determination for Reconciliation and Cash Settlement

 

Display and edit of price elements in Manage Preliminary Billing Documents - Services app (Professional Services)

The feature allows project-billing specialists or billing team members to efficiently manage pricing conditions at both the header and item levels, enabling quick adaptations through an intuitive user interface.

This feature delivers significant operational benefits by streamlining the billing process for project-billing specialists and billing teams. By reducing the time required for pricing adaptations through an intuitive interface, organizations can achieve faster billing cycles and improved process efficiency. The ability to make quick pricing adjustments directly translates to reduced administrative overhead, faster revenue recognition, and enhanced responsiveness to project changes or client requirements.

The feature introduces a new pricing elements facet that empowers users to manage pricing conditions at both header and item levels within preliminary billing documents. Users can display existing price conditions, create new ones, and modify or delete manually created price conditions as needed. The system supports comprehensive pricing updates, allowing users to adjust prices for all items at the header level or make targeted changes to individual line items, providing granular control over billing document pricing structure.

Figure: Display and edit of price elements in Manage Preliminary Billing Documents - Services app

Figure: Display and edit of price elements in Manage Preliminary Billing Documents - Services app

 

Returns Order OData v4 API: enhancements such as creation with reference and creation for advanced variant configuration

With the "Customer Return (A2X)" OData V4 API, you can now do the following:
  • Create returns orders with reference to preceding documents, such as sales orders, sales orders without charge, or invoices.
  • Create returns orders for configurable materials that use advanced variant configuration (AVC).
  • Help Document: Create with Reference
  • Help Document: Variant Configuration

The enhanced Returns Order OData v4 API delivers significant operational flexibility for businesses managing customer returns processes. By enabling the creation of returns orders with direct references to preceding documents like sales orders and invoices, organizations can streamline their returns workflow and maintain better traceability throughout the customer service lifecycle. Additionally, support for advanced variant configuration (AVC) materials ensures that companies selling complex, configurable products can efficiently process returns for customized items, reducing manual processing time and improving customer satisfaction through faster return handling.

 

Customer returns for sales kits with warehouse management

With this feature, you can process the returns of sales kits in Warehouse Management. You can enter a storage location that is managed by Warehouse Management in a returns order item or returns delivery. The storage location specified in the main item of a returns order item is copied to all its subitems. You can change the storage location at the subitem level.

This feature significantly enhances the end-to-end customer experience by streamlining the returns process for sales kits across all four available variants (ERLA, LUMF, CPFH, and DISH). By integrating customer returns with warehouse management systems, businesses can provide more efficient and consistent handling of returned sales kits, reducing processing time and improving customer satisfaction. The feature enables regular logistical follow-up activities, ensuring better visibility and control over the returns process while maintaining operational efficiency throughout the entire returns lifecycle.

The feature allows users to process sales kit returns directly within the Warehouse Management system by enabling the specification of warehouse-managed storage locations in returns orders and deliveries. When a storage location is defined at the main item level of a returns order, the system automatically propagates this location to all associated subitems, ensuring consistency across the entire sales kit. Users retain the flexibility to modify storage locations at the individual subitem level when needed, providing granular control over where different components of the returned sales kit are stored and managed within the warehouse infrastructure.

Graphic: Customer returns for sales kits with warehouse managementFigure: Customer returns for sales kits with warehouse management

Check out the presentation and demo for details.

  • Presentation: EKT_returns_and_warehouse_integration_for_sales_kits
  • Demo: Returns_and_Warehoue_Integration_E2E_Demo

We will explain this feature in detail in the upcoming SAP S/4HANA Product Expert Training . Please register for the Sales session. The session is open to SAP Partners. 

 

Managing Price Agreements in Sales Contracts - 2508 Scope

The price agreement processing for sales contract allows business to efficiently mange the sales contract specific prices or discounts per product hierarchy and its nodes. With the automatic contract assignment in subsequent sales order processing, the price agreements is applied to sales orders items with certain product hierarchy determinations.

The price agreement processing feature delivers significant operational efficiency by automating the management of product-specific pricing and discounts across sales contracts. This automation reduces manual effort in maintaining dummy products within value contracts while providing an intuitive user experience for managing complex product hierarchies and their associated pricing agreements. The streamlined processing increases efficiency in both sales contract integrations and sales order operations, enabling businesses to offer targeted special pricing to end customers based on specific product hierarchy nodes while minimizing administrative overhead.

The feature enables comprehensive product hierarchy and price agreement maintenance within value contracts through both the Fiori UI and OData V4 API. It supports automatic contract assignment during sales order processing, where the system can determine product hierarchy based on input products and automatically match contract items to products or product hierarchy nodes. Key capabilities include maintaining product hierarchy nodes on sales contract items, determining appropriate price agreements in sales orders, and enabling sales contract automatic assignment functionality that applies relevant pricing structures based on product hierarchy determinations during order processing.

Watch this demo to have a complete view of the feature.

 

Demo: Managing Price Agreements in Sales Contracts - 2508 Scope

 

Debit Memo Request OData V4 API - create without reference, initial scope to include pricing elements, partner entities, and more

The OData V4 API Debit Memo Request (A2X) offers both synchronous and asynchronous processing, and makes the data of debit memo requests available through its header, item, partner, pricing element, and text entities. With this service, you can do the following:

  • Create debit memo requests from scratch.
  • Read entire debit memo requests or only parts of the data, using the provided filters.
  • Create, read, and update debit memo requests with subentities, or delete subentitites for existing debit memo requests. Subentities include header partner, header pricing element, header text, item, item partner, item pricing element, and item text.

The Debit Memo Request OData v4 API enables organizations to efficiently manage debit memo requests programmatically, supporting end-to-end automation and seamless integration with external systems. By leveraging the ABAP RESTful application programming model and the latest OData v4 protocol, it delivers a modern, scalable interface for creating and maintaining debit memo requests, improving process agility and data consistency. Support for both synchronous and asynchronous processing provides flexibility for real-time and background use cases, helping reduce manual effort, accelerate billing adjustments, and ensure accurate partner, pricing, and textual context is captured and maintained.

The API exposes core debit memo request entities, including the header and item, along with their related subentities: partner, pricing elements, and text at both header and item levels. It supports creation without reference (creating debit memo requests from scratch), reading entire requests or selective subsets via filters, and managing subentities with fine-grained operations. Specifically, you can create, read, and update debit memo requests and their subentities—header partner, header pricing element, header text, item, item partner, item pricing element, and item text—or delete subentities for existing requests. Processing is available in synchronous and asynchronous modes to suit different integration patterns.

  • Help Document: Debit Memo Request (A2X, OData V4)

 

Creation and editing of sales orders without charge with the Manage Sales Orders Without Charge - Version 2 app (F2305A)

With this lightweight app, you can create, change, or display sales orders without charge containing key information in a fast and easy way. You can do so directly within the Manage Sales Orders Without Charge - Version 2 app, whereas in the Manage Sales Orders Without Charge app that was already available before, you need to navigate to other apps. You can also list all sales orders without charge, filter the results, or search for specific sales orders without charge.

  • Help Document: Manage Sales Orders Without Charge - Version 2

The app boosts speed, efficiency, and flexibility for handling zero-value sales processes. By enabling end-to-end creation and editing of Delivery Free of Charge orders (CBFD) and streamlined display of Replacement Delivery Orders (SD2) in a single, lightweight interface, it reduces clicks and context switching. Quick actions and mass data entry via XLS cut-and-paste accelerate daily work, while key-user adaptation ensures the UI aligns with company best practices—improving user productivity, data quality, and time-to-value with minimal IT involvement.

The app lets users create, change, and display sales orders without charge directly within the app, eliminating the need to navigate to other apps. It supports efficient creation and editing for CBFD orders and display capability for SD2 orders, and offers listing, filtering, and search to quickly find relevant orders. Key-user adaptation allows showing, hiding, or rearranging standard and extension fields to tailor the UI. Quick actions streamline common tasks, and XLS cut-and-paste enables fast mass entry of item data for high-volume scenarios.

Figure: Creation and editing of sales orders without charge with the Fiori app 'Manage Sales Orders Without Charge - Version 2'

Figure: Creation and editing of sales orders without charge with the Fiori app 'Manage Sales Orders Without Charge - Version 2'

 

Credit memo requests and debit memo requests with variant configuration (single material)

With this feature, you can process the credit memo requests and debit memo requests with configurable materials that use advanced variant configuration (AVC) ordered by a customer.
Variant configuration is used for the manufacturing of complex products with many variants (for example, cars, where customers can choose from long lists of options and possible combinations). For more information, see Advanced Variant Configuration.

This feature streamlines post-sales adjustments for configurable products by enabling credit memo requests and debit memo requests for materials using advanced variant configuration (AVC). Organizations can process pricing-correct and configuration-aware credits/debits for a single configurable material without manual rework, improving cycle times, accuracy, and user experience. It reduces errors from re-entering configurations, ensures consistent variant-driven pricing, and supports industries with complex, option-rich products by aligning claims and corrections with the exact configuration the customer ordered.

The new scope item allows creation of credit memo requests and debit memo requests for single-level configurable materials, either with or without reference to preceding documents. It supports variant configuration explosion within the request so that the selected characteristics and components are reflected in the document structure. Pricing determination leverages the variant configuration, ensuring that configuration-dependent prices and surcharges are correctly applied. The capability is designed for single-level materials using AVC, covering both credit and debit processes with configuration-aware document handling.

We will explain this feature in detail in the upcoming SAP S/4HANA Product Expert Training . Please register for the Sales session. The session is open to SAP Partners. 

 

Cloud BAdI to modify sales document data in finalize phase before save

With the Modification of Sales Document in Finalize Phase before Save (SD_SLS_FINALIZE) BAdI, you can set or change custom fields at the sales order header and item level. You can also set or change the rejection reason at the sales document item level. This BAdI is only called for sales orders and sales orders without charge. It is not called when the sales document is processed indirectly by processes such as credit management, backorder processing, the creation of advanced intercompany sales orders, or other similar processes.

This cloud BAdI enhances extensibility and control over sales documents in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition by letting customers enforce company-specific rules and build process variants without heavy custom development. By running only in the finalize phase before save, it minimizes performance impact while ensuring critical custom fields are validated or derived consistently, improving data quality and user experience. It empowers organizations to tailor behavior for standard sales orders and sales orders without charge, supporting nuanced business scenarios and governance needs.

The Modification of Sales Document in Finalize Phase before Save BAdI (SD_SLS_FINALIZE) allows setting or changing custom fields at the sales order header and item levels, and adjusting the rejection reason at item level. The BAdI grants access to key sales document data—including header, item, and schedule line—so customers can compute values prior to persistence. It is applicable in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and is invoked only for sales orders and sales orders without charge, not for indirectly processed scenarios such as credit management, backorder processing, or advanced intercompany sales. This ensures targeted execution at save time to reliably influence header and item custom fields.

Check out the presentation and help document for more details. 

  • Presentation: EKT_Sales_Order_BAdI_Finalize
  • Help Document: Business Add-Ins (BAdIs) for Sales Documents

 

CDS view and API for material listing and exclusion

API for Sales Material Listing & Exclusion Conditions
The inbound service Condition Record for Material Listing and Exclusion in Sales (A2X, OData V4) enables you to create, read, update, and delete condition records for material listing and exclusion from external systems.
  • Help Document: Condition Record for Material Listing and Exclusion in Sales (A2X, OData V4)
  • Presentation: EKT_OData_API_Sales_Listing_and_Exclusion_CE25023
CDS view extractor for material listing and exclusion
The CDS view Condition Record for Material Listing and Exclusion (I_SLSMATLLSTGOREXCLSNRECORD) retrieves the condition records (based on standard or custom condition tables) for material listing and exclusion.
  • Help Document: Condition Record for Material Listing and Exclusion

This capability streamlines governance over which materials can be sold to which customers by providing a standard OData V4 API to maintain sales-material listing and exclusion condition records in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. It enables efficient, automated master data maintenance and checks within sales documents, improving compliance, reducing order-entry errors, and accelerating processing. External systems can seamlessly integrate to create and update rules programmatically, while a CDS-based extractor supports reliable replication and analytics in downstream platforms through both full and delta modes.

The inbound OData V4 service “Condition Record for Material Listing and Exclusion in Sales” (A2X) supports synchronous and asynchronous processing to create, read, update, and delete condition records for material listing and exclusion from external systems. For data extraction and analysis, the CDS view “Condition Record for Material Listing and Exclusion” (I_SLSMATLLSTGOREXCLSNRECORD) retrieves condition records based on standard or custom condition tables and supports full and delta extraction, enabling efficient data transfer to external consumers. 

 

Integration of payment by link in sales billing

With this feature, you can generate a payment link in the form of a QR code on the output of your billing documents, for example, on the printed invoice. By scanning the code, your customers can access a payment page to settle the payment using various digital payment types. This feature is provided by the SAP digital payments add-on, which connects with payment service providers (PSPs) to facilitate the secure, end-to-end processing of digital payments.

This feature delivers significant business value by accelerating cash flow and improving customer satisfaction through streamlined payment processes. By embedding payment links or QR codes directly on billing documents like invoices, companies can reduce payment delays and friction in the collection process. Customers benefit from a simplified, modern payment experience that eliminates the need for manual payment entry or check writing, while businesses see faster settlement of outstanding receivables and reduced administrative overhead in payment processing.

The integration of payment by link functionality within SAP Sales Billing automatically generates QR codes on billing document outputs such as printed invoices. When customers scan these codes with their mobile devices, they are directed to a secure payment page that supports multiple digital payment methods. The feature leverages SAP's digital payments add-on, which seamlessly connects with various payment service providers (PSPs) to ensure secure, end-to-end transaction processing. This integration maintains data integrity within the SAP environment while providing customers with immediate access to convenient payment options directly from their billing documents.

Check out the following presentations and help document.

  • Presentation: EKT_Integration_of_Payment_By_Link_in_Sales_Billing_25021CE
  • Help Document: Payment by Link in Billing Documents

Watch this demo to have a complete view of the feature.

 

Demo: Integration of payment by link in sales billing

 

Handling expiring prices with Joule

You can ask Joule to fetch prices (stored as condition records for pricing in sales in the system) that will expire soon. For expiring prices, Joule can help renew them by extending their validity periods and adjusting the condition amounts or ratios according to your requirements.

You can ask Joule to perform the following tasks:

  • Fetch and display prices approaching expiration based on certain criteria.
  • Extend valid-to dates by a period or to a specific date.
  • Adjust condition amounts or ratios proportionally for the new validity period.
  • Create new condition records for the price renewal in a single job.
  • Track the job progress.
  • Open prices and job details in the "Manage Prices - Sales" app.

This feature delivers substantial business value by preventing revenue loss and pricing errors through proactive expiration management and streamlined price maintenance. By leveraging Joule's conversational AI capabilities, pricing specialists can identify expiring prices, discounts, and surcharges before they become invalid, eliminating costly pricing corrections and potential lost sales opportunities. The natural language interface dramatically reduces the time required to create and update pricing conditions from hours to seconds, enabling pricing teams to be more responsive to market changes while maintaining pricing accuracy and consistency across the organization.

The expiring price handling feature powered by Joule enables users to interact conversationally with the AI assistant to monitor and manage pricing condition records in SAP. Users can query Joule to identify prices, discounts, or surcharges approaching expiration within specified timeframes (days, months, or years) and receive comprehensive displays of these conditions. Joule facilitates price renewal by extending validity periods to specific dates or by duration, adjusting condition amounts through percentage increases or decreases, and maintaining existing values as needed. The system creates new condition records through a single conversational job, provides real-time progress tracking, and seamlessly integrates with the "Manage Prices - Sales" app for detailed review and further modifications.

Check out the following demo and help document.

  • Demo: Renew_Product_Prices_with_Joule_Internal
  • Help Document: Renew Expiring Prices

Watch this demo to have a complete view of the feature.

 

Demo: Handling expiring prices with Joule

 

Creation of customer invoice before posting of goods issue

Create a new scope item that enables the customer invoice to be created before the goods issue is posted through the following sequence of process steps:

  • Creation of a sales order, including availability check
  • Creation of the subsequent invoice before goods issue has taken place
  • Posting of goods issue while the invoice already exists

This new scope item increases process flexibility by allowing organizations to create the customer invoice before goods issue is posted. It helps companies prepare required billing documents earlier in the order-to-cash cycle, improving their ability to fulfill export documentation needs and adhere to international customs regulations. By decoupling invoice creation from physical shipment, businesses can reduce delays related to documentation and ensure smoother cross-border processing.

The scope item defines a controlled sequence of process steps: first, create the sales order with an availability check; second, create the subsequent customer invoice before goods issue has taken place; and finally, post the goods issue while the invoice already exists. This process variant enables billing to occur ahead of logistics completion, providing the necessary invoice documentation in advance while preserving standard posting of goods issue thereafter.

Figure: Creation of customer invoice before posting of goods issue

Figure: Creation of customer invoice before posting of goods issue

 

Joule: AI-assisted sales order status check

Joule allows you to check whether a sales order's fulfillment is on track and identify the issues that block its fulfillment. For each sales order, Joule can tell whether such issues exist in the order processing phase. If yes, you can display issue details, view possible causes and handling suggestions for each issue, and navigate to related apps.

This feature significantly enhances operational efficiency by providing instant, natural language insights into sales order fulfillment status and accelerating issue resolution. By translating complex fulfillment data into easily understandable language, Joule empowers sales teams, customer service representatives, and order management staff to quickly identify bottlenecks and take corrective action. This leads to improved customer satisfaction through faster order processing, reduced fulfillment delays, and more proactive communication about order status. The intuitive AI-driven approach eliminates the need for users to navigate complex system screens or interpret technical status codes, resulting in faster response times and more efficient order management workflows.

The AI-assisted Sales Order Status Check feature enables users to interact with Joule using natural language queries to assess sales order fulfillment progress and identify blocking issues. Joule analyzes the sales order processing pipeline and translates technical fulfillment statuses into conversational responses that clearly indicate whether orders are on track or experiencing delays. When issues are detected, the system provides detailed explanations of each problem, suggests potential root causes, and offers specific handling recommendations for resolution. Users can seamlessly navigate from Joule's analysis to relevant SAP applications for deeper investigation or corrective action, creating an integrated workflow that bridges conversational AI insights with traditional system functionality.

Check for details in the help document: Help Document: Sales Order Status Check

Watch this demo to have a complete view of the feature.

 

Demo: Joule: AI-assisted sales order status check

entry.title: Re: Employee Replication from S/4HANA Cloud Public Editio...
entry.content:
Hello @klicklas 

In the SAP-managed S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition ↔ Sales Cloud V2 integration (part of SAP Grow Premium), there is currently no standard iFlow available for directly replicating Employee master data from S/4HANA Public Cloud to Sales Cloud V2. This contrasts with the on-premises S/4HANA → C4C package, which includes a dedicated Replicate Employee iFlow.

Recommendation:

  • If you utilize SuccessFactors, replicate employees from SuccessFactors to both systems using IAM, which is the recommended SAP method.
  • If you do not use SuccessFactors, create a custom iFlow in SAP Cloud Integration by using below
  • Source: API_WORKFORCE_PERSON from S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition.
  • Target: Sales Cloud V2 Employee/User OData service.
  • Include mapping for BP role BUP003 and required login/ownership fields.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Importing Data from Multiple Excel Sheets into a Model
entry.content:
@Carvalho_A1 

You can use import job with file as a source. In the Data Management tab of the model, you can create an import job with Excel file as source. When you setup the import job it will detect the first sheet of the Excel be default. You can run the import by replacing the same file and selecting the second sheet the second time of the load. You will have to map the Excel sheet columns to the model dimension and measures.

 

Nikhil

entry.title: Re: Error while Generating Runtime objects
entry.content:
Hello,

I ran into this same issue and found it was caused by an extra comma in my types definition. 

Example: (In the field 2 you can see the two commas at the end of the line.)

Types: begin of ty_my_type,
       field 1 type C length 10,
       Field 2 type C length 15,,
       field 3 type C length 10.
Types: end of ty_my_type.

 Thanks,

Eric

entry.title: Access via OTP received by email and TFA (phone or authenticator app)
entry.content:
Desired goal of login flow should be: 

  1. The user request for an OTP by email
  2. The user uses the OTP (as the first factor)
  3. 2FA is prompted, asking for phone or authenticator
  4. User must provide the second factor to access the app and receive a valid Gigya's session or SMS code

 

Is this flow supported in CDC?

entry.title: Improper warning message for service materials with no ATP check
entry.content:
Why does S/4HANA trigger warning message AG024 for service materials with no ATP check, while the same scenario runs without any message in ECC?


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Improper warning message for service materials with n...
entry.content:
In S/4HANA, warning message AG024 for service materials without ATP check appears because of changes in the ATP (Available-to-Promise) framework and system messaging logic compared to ECC.

When creating a sales order in VA01, the system sets the internal flag atp_gruppenaufruf to "X". This flag indicates that a grouped ATP check is being triggered. Even if the material master has no availability check configured (blank in Sales: Plant Data), S/4HANA still executes part of the ATP logic to validate scheduling and availability context, and this process can raise informational or warning messages.

In ECC, although the same variable and ATP structures exist, the message logic linked to this scenario was either inactive or handled silently in the standard code, so no message was shown. In S/4HANA, SAP redesigned the ATP process to emphasize transparency and user feedback, so scenarios that could potentially lead to availability or scheduling misalignment now produce messages — even if they were silent in ECC. This is meant to give users a clearer understanding of how the system is handling checks and why certain availability fields are blank or certain confirmations are skipped.

From a technical perspective, this is standard behavior in S/4HANA.

entry.title: Integration & Extensibility - Bulgaria EUR Transition for S/4HANA Cloud Public Cloud Live Customers
entry.content:
This is only relevant for Partners and Live Customers who are required to transit Production system data with EUR adoption in Bulgaria. In the 2nd session offered by ASC Cloud ERP Expertise Services,  two main topics are covered , Integration and Extensibility.

  • Recording on August 13, 2025 Bulgaria EUR Transition for Live Customers (Integration & Extensibility)
  • Presentation on August 13, 2025 Bulgaria EUR Transition for Live Customers (Integration & Extensibility)
  • Accelerator
    • Bulgaria EUR Transition for Live Customers (Integration & Extensibility) Extensibility Generic Guidelines
    • Bulgaria EUR Transition for Live Customers (Integration & Extensibility) S4HC Extensibility Template
    • Bulgaria EUR Transition for Live Customers (Integration & Extensibility) Integration Generic Guidelines
    • Bulgaria EUR Transition for Live Customers (Integration & Extensibility) S4HC_Integration Template

Key Discussion Points‌

‌1. Integration

‌Overview:‌ Focused on system integration impacts due to Bulgaria's EUR transition, including company code, currency, and cost center changes.

  • ‌Accelerators Provided:‌
    • ‌Interface Assessment Guide:‌ Lists affected interfaces (e.g., SAP-to-SAP, third-party) based on company code/currency dependencies.
    • ‌Step-by-Step Change Guide:‌ Covers middleware adjustments (filters, value mappings), prerequisites before making any changes, master data replication, and testing.
  • ‌Key SAP Integrations:‌
    • ‌SuccessFactors:‌ Requires new legal entity creation and cost center reassignment.
    • ‌Fieldglass/ Concur/ Ariba:‌ Updates to WBS structures and cost center mappings.

‌2. Extensibility

  • ‌Scope:‌ Covers key user (UI fields, custom logic, Custom CDS, Output Forms) and developer (ADT tools, BTP apps) extensibility.
  • ‌Checklist for Custom Objects:‌
    • ‌Custom Fields/Logic/Custom CDS/Custom Business Objects:‌ Verify hardcoded company codes/currencies.
    • Output Management Master/Content Forms : Verify Rule Determination for Master Forms and Output Parameter Determination for Content forms, check logic implemented directly in the custom Forms
    • ‌Forms/Workflows:‌ Update determination rules for new company codes.
  • ‌Tools:‌
    • ‌Extensibility Inventory App:‌ Export custom objects for analysis.
    • ‌ADT (Eclipse):‌ Manually scan developer extensibility code for hardcoded values.

2. Live Questions & Answers

‌Topic Area‌

‌Question‌

‌Answer‌

‌Extensibility Tools‌

Is there a tool to mass-check custom logic for hardcoded company codes/currencies?

No automated scanner exists. For developer extensibility, use Eclipse ADT to manually search code. For key user extensibility, export objects via the Extensibility Inventory App and review individually.

‌Extensibility Inventory‌

Should we export the extensibility inventory from production?

Yes, filter exported objects in production to focus on active customizations. Non-promoted items in development can be ignored.

‌Session Coverage‌

Are similar sessions available for S/4HANA On-Premise?

No confirmed sessions. On-Premise guidance differs (e.g., secondary company code approach). Refer to SAP Notes for details.

‌Troubleshooting‌

How to troubleshoot integration/extensibility issues post-changes?

Use integration traces (payload analysis) and debug custom logic in ADT. Enable custom logic tracing for detailed error tracking.

entry.title: From Compliance to Confidence Mastering Global Pharmaceuticals Serialization with SAP
entry.content:
Have you ever paused to consider the journey your prescription medicine takes before it reaches your hands and how you can be certain it’s genuine? Ensuring the authenticity of medicines isn’t just a regulatory requirement; it’s central to protecting public health and building trust in the healthcare system.

Globally, the challenge is significant. The World Health Organization reports that at least one in ten medicines in low- and middle-income countries is substandard or falsified. In some regions, the numbers are even higher research published in The Guardian shows that nearly 20% of medicines in Africa fail quality tests, contributing to as many as 500,000 deaths annually in sub-Saharan Africa, according to UN estimates. The economic impact is equally sobering, with unsafe medicines costing the global economy an estimated US $30.5 billion each year. Even in highly regulated markets, risks persist up to 50% of prescription drugs purchased online may be counterfeit.

 

Figure 1: The Global Impact of Falsified Medicines

 

The good news? Industry leaders, regulators, and technology providers are making unprecedented strides to close these gaps. Regulatory frameworks such as the US Drug Supply Chain Security Act (DSCSA) and the European Falsified Medicines Directive (FMD) are setting new standards for end-to-end visibility, enabling the industry to track medicines throughout the supply chain and prevent falsified products from reaching patients. Imagine the peace of mind of instantly verifying the authenticity of every medicine, this is no longer a distant vision, but an achievable reality.

In this article, we’ll explore how pharmaceutical manufacturers, wholesalers, distributors, and dispensers can go beyond compliance to turn serialization into a competitive advantage. We’ll look at strategies for meeting DSCSA and FMD requirements efficiently, streamlining data exchange, and optimizing supply chain operations. And we’ll examine how advanced serialization solutions such as SAP Advanced Track and Trace for pharmaceuticals as well as SAP Information Collaboration Hub for Life Sciences can help safeguard patients, protect brand integrity, and set new benchmarks for operational excellence.

We will answer the following questions:

1. Why Serialization in the Pharma Industry is Critical? Understanding the importance of serialization and the obstacles companies face in implementing it.

2. How SAP Solutions Help Comply with Pharma Serialization Regulations? Exploring practical ways SAP technology supports adherence to DSCSA, EU FMD, and other global mandates.

 2.1. Discovering SAP Advanced Track and Trace for Pharmaceuticals (SAP ATTP).

2.2. Discovering SAP Information Collaboration Hub for Life Sciences  (SAP ICH)

3. What are the Business Values of Adopting SAP Serialization Solutions? Examining how serialization software not only ensures compliance but also adds strategic value to the pharmaceutical supply chain.

 

1. Why Serialization in the Pharma Industry is important?

 

The world of pharmaceutical traceability is rapidly evolving. Regulations like the US DSCSA and EU FMD aren’t just legal checkboxes they’re catalysts for a fundamental transformation in how prescription drugs are tracked, verified, and delivered. This shift isn’t limited to the US and Europe. Countries such as Brazil, Russia, India, Saudi Arabia, Turkey, and China have also implemented their own serialization and traceability mandates, each with unique requirements and timelines. The trend is accelerating, with more nations actively exploring or drafting similar regulations. For pharmaceutical companies operating in these markets, compliance is not optional, it’s essential to secure market access, maintain customer trust, and protect brand reputation in an increasingly regulated global landscape.

At the core of these regulations lies serialization, the process of assigning each medicine pack a unique digital identifier, or serial number. Think of this serial number as a digital fingerprint: it links the product to its manufacturer, batch, and production date. As a medicine travels through the supply chain from the manufacturer to wholesalers, distributors, and ultimately to pharmacies or hospitals, its serial number is scanned and recorded at every step. This critical data is then reported to national databases, which act as vigilant guardians, allowing regulators to quickly authenticate medicines, identify suspicious activity, and remove compromised drugs from circulation. Figure 2 provides a clear visual of this complex journey, highlighting the interwoven challenges of serialization, collaboration, and reporting across the pharmaceutical supply chain.

What does this mean for every player in the pharma supply chain?

  • Manufacturers / Market Authroization Holder must assign unique digital IDs to every product and precisely share that data from the factory floor to the pharmacy shelf and report it.
  • Wholesalers and distributors become digital guardians, verifying authenticity and diligently passing on each product's complete digital story.
  • Dispensers (pharmacies, hospitals) serve as final gatekeepers, swiftly verifying medication to ensure undisputed authenticity and safeguard patient safety.

 

Figure 2 : Navigating the Pharmaceutical Supply Chain: A Visual of Serialization's Core Challenges Compliance, Collaboration, and Reporting

 

You might be wondering how exactly does serialization confirm that a medicine is authentic? When a pharmacy scans a serialized code, the system checks whether the serial number matches the records in a secure, centralized database. If the number is missing, duplicated, or invalid, the system flags the medicine as potentially falsified, preventing it from reaching the patient. Serialization, therefore, transforms every medicine pack into a traceable and verifiable entity, empowering regulators, healthcare providers, and patients alike to ensure that only genuine medicines are dispensed.

 

2. How SAP Solutions Help Comply with Pharma Serialization Regulations?

 

Pharma supply chain executives are asking a critical question: How can we comply with evolving global regulations that mandate serialization, collaboration, and reporting?

The answer lies in embedding serialization process and technology into the very fabric of core operational processes, integrating it at the manufacturing stage on packaging lines and extending it into logistics centers to capture serialized data at every point of transfer. Yet serialization at the point of production is only the foundation. The greater strategic value emerges when this data is connected through a secure, enterprise-wide traceability network linking manufacturers, regulatory authorities, distributors, and dispensers. Such an interconnected system enables real-time information exchange and ensures that every node in the supply chain is safeguarded against falsified products.

Achieving this level of supply chain integrity goes beyond mere compliance it requires a comprehensive, enterprise-wide serialization strategy. Such a strategy must be anchored in advanced technology, fully integrated with your existing IT landscape particularly backend ERP and warehouse management systems and aligned with global regulatory frameworks, and embedded within the organization’s quality management systems. To enable this, pharmaceutical companies need purpose-built serialization platforms that can automate processes across all manufacturing sites, packaging lines, and logistics operations, while ensuring scalability, interoperability, and seamless data exchange across the entire supply chain.

SAP Advanced Track and Trace for Pharmaceuticals (SAP ATTP) and SAP Information Collaboration Hub for Life Sciences (SAP ICH) deliver exactly what the industry needs to meet today’s complex serialization and traceability demands. Purpose-built for the pharmaceutical sector, these solutions work hand in hand: SAP ATTP serves as the enterprise’s internal control center for managing serialization across all manufacturing and logistics operations, while SAP ICH acts as a secure global network for sharing serialization and traceability data with external partners, including regulatory authorities, wholesalers, and distributors.

Trusted by the world’s leading pharmaceutical companies and governments, SAP ATTP and SAP ICH are widely regarded as the gold standard for running global serialization and track-and-trace programs. Together, they transform demanding regulatory requirements into efficient, data-driven processes delivering full visibility, ensuring compliance, and safeguarding patient safety across the entire supply chain. Figure 3 vividly illustrates how SAP ATTP provides internal control, while SAP ICH acts as the global connector, bringing this end-to-end traceability to life.

 

Figure 3: Visualizing End-to-End Traceability: SAP ATTP (Level 4) for Internal Control and SAP ICH (Level 5) for Global Connectivity

 

 

2.1. Discovering SAP Advanced Track and Trace for Pharmaceuticals 

Think of SAP ATTP as the central brain managing every digital detail of your product's unique identity inside your four walls. Its core capabilities directly support compliance for manufacturers by:

  1. Serial Number Management: Securely generating, managing, commissioning (assigning to products), and decommissioning unique serial numbers for every unit, as mandated by regulations like US DSCSA and EU FMD.
  2. EPCIS Event Management: Acting as a comprehensive repository for all EPCIS events the digital "breadcrumbs" recording every significant step from aggregation to shipping. This detailed capture is foundational for proving compliance and enabling traceability.
  3. Internal Traceability & Audit Trails: Providing robust internal traceability to instantly pinpoint any serialized product's journey within your operations, creating a complete, auditable record for regulatory inquiries.
  4. Master Data Integration: Seamlessly integrating with existing enterprise systems such as your SAP ERP and SAP warehouse management systems to ensure consistent and accurate serialization processes.

In essence, SAP ATTP functions as the enterprise-level “brain” of your serialization system (Level 4). While lower levels manage serialization at individual packaging lines, Level 4 coordinates the entire enterprise serialization processes, ensuring operations are seamless, fully compliant, and highly collaborative across all sites and partners.

However, even a perfectly implemented, enterprise-wide serialization platform like SAP ATTP is only part of the story. The moment a serialized product leaves your facility, its digital “fingerprint” must travel with it seamlessly exchanged with every supply chain partner and reported to regulatory authorities. Traceability and reporting are no longer optional; they are mandatory. This is where the regulatory vision meets the hard reality of operations and technology. What might seem like a simple compliance task quickly becomes a complex, multi-dimensional challenge, amplified by the need to connect a fragmented global supply chain.

Consider the following real-world scenario:

  • Exchange with a CMO: You manufacture a batch internally, but a Contract Manufacturing Organization (CMO) handles the packaging. You must provide them with the serialized numbers, and they, in turn, must report packaging events back to you and, in some cases, directly to a national regulatory system.

  • Shipping to a Distributor: Once packaged, your products move to a distributor. With the physical shipment, the entire list of serialized units must be electronically transferred. The distributor then confirms receipt and may need to share the data further downstream.

  • Regulatory Reporting: Simultaneously, information about manufacturing, packaging, and shipment must be reported to national databases such as the European Medicines Verification System (EMVS) or the FDA’s DSCSA system each with strict formats, timelines, and submission protocols.

This chain of events shows how serialization quickly evolves from a simple compliance task into a strategic, operational challenge that demands integrated, enterprise-level solutions. It’s not just about sharing a few files global manufacturers may need to exchange data for over a billion items annually. That information must flow seamlessly across multiple trading partners CMOs, wholesalers, distributors, each with different IT systems, data formats, and communication protocols. On top of this, varying regulatory requirements in each country add complexity, while the volume of data and the need for real-time verification create significant technological challenges for capture, storage, and exchange.

While SAP Advanced Track and Trace for Pharmaceuticals (SAP ATTP) brilliantly manages the serialization process, the real challenge arises in exchanging this vital data with external trading partners. This external connectivity is essential for both regulatory compliance and seamless supply chain continuity. Historically, building "point-to-point" integrations for each partner, though technically feasible, proved a technical and financial nightmare. Imagine building a custom road for every single delivery truck; these traditional methods lead to:

  • Prohibitive Costs: High development and ongoing maintenance.
  • Operational Inefficiency: A sprawling, brittle IT landscape.
  • Scalability Hurdles: Unsustainable as your network grows.
  • Data Inconsistencies: Leading to discrepancies and failures.

2.2. Discovering SAP Information Collaboration Hub for Life Sciences  

This is precisely where SAP Information Collaboration Hub for Life Sciences (SAP ICH) steps in as strategic complementing solution. SAP ICH is a cloud-based, multi-enterprise business network designed as your Level 5 global connector. Think of it as the ultimate central nervous system for your serialization data, enabling flawless, secure exchange with all your trading partners. Pharma companies can connect once to the SAP Information Collaboration Hub for Life Sciences and seamlessly interoperate with all existing network participants. This approach saves significant time and effort, eliminating the need to build multiple point-to-point integrations with each trading partner.

At its core, SAP Information Collaboration Hub for Life Sciences (SAP ICH) acts as a sophisticated digital switchboard, intelligently managing all external serialization data exchange. Its high-level capabilities include:

  1. Streamlined Supply Chain Partner Onboarding: The hub simplifies onboarding new trading partners through standardized processes, significantly reducing technical burden.
  2. Centralized Data Exchange: It serves as a single, secure gateway for all external serialization data (like EPCIS events), routing information to and from diverse partners (CMOs, 3PLs, customers) efficiently.
  3. Regulatory Reporting Support: It streamlines the complex process of submitting required serialization data to national regulatory databases in correct, country-specific formats.
  4. Automated Data Transformation: SAP ICH automatically converts data to meet varied regulatory requirements, including country-specific formats for DSCSA and EU FMD compliance, ensuring both outgoing compliance and incoming usability.

These capabilities collectively make SAP ICH an indispensable pharma network for achieving compliance, cutting costs, and gaining crucial visibility and control over your extended pharmaceutical supply chain. It moves beyond managing serial numbers to truly orchestrating their global journey.

 

3. What are the Business Values of Adopting SAP Serialization Solutions?

 

The true power for end-to-end product compliance traceability comes from the seamless collaboration between SAP ATTP and SAP ICH. While SAP ATTP acts as the meticulous librarian for your internal product fingerprints, SAP ICH functions as your secure courier and universal translator. It intelligently routes your internal data, ensuring compliance with diverse, country-specific formats (e.g. DSCSA, EU FMD), and securely exchanges this information with everyone from CMOs and 3PLs to wholesalers, dispensers, and regulatory authorities. This complementary design extends your internal serialization capabilities to your entire external ecosystem, ensuring unified and highly efficient data flow.

The combined strength of SAP Advanced Track and Trace for Pharmaceuticals (SAP ATTP) and SAP Information Collaboration Hub (SAP ICH) delivers a transformative advantage, turning regulatory obligations into strategic opportunities. These intelligent serialization solutions operate seamlessly in the background, automating vast volumes of data exchange and regulatory reporting. This enables a “manage by exception” approach your teams focus on critical issues, not routine transactions. The strategic impact is substantial and measurable:

  1. Risk Mitigation & Brand Protection: Advanced serialization safeguards against non-compliance fines, counterfeit recalls, and reputational damage, ensuring patient safety and protecting your brand.

  2. Significant Cost Reduction: By replacing complex point-to-point integrations and minimizing manual effort, IT and operational costs can be reduced by up to 50%.

  3. Accelerated Time to Market & Partner Onboarding: Streamlined integration enables faster onboarding of new partners and products, shortening timelines by weeks or even months, enhancing agility in global markets.

  4. Enhanced Efficiency & Visibility: Secure, automated data exchange provides real-time oversight, supporting a 10–15% reduction in logistics costs and shorter delivery lead times.

By transforming compliance into an automated, integrated process, SAP ATTP and SAP ICH empower pharmaceutical industry to not only meet the rigorous demands of DSCSA, EU FMD, and other global regulations, but to redefine their supply chain as a secure, efficient, and future-ready competitive asset.

 

Conclusion

 

 

 

 

 

In the rapidly evolving pharmaceutical landscape, serialization has emerged as a key driver of both patient safety and competitive advantage. It is no longer merely a regulatory requirement it is a strategic differentiator that enables companies to build trust, ensure product integrity, and future-proof their operations. SAP equips pharmaceutical leaders to turn these challenges into opportunities through the integrated power of SAP Advanced Track and Trace for Pharmaceuticals (SAP ATTP) and SAP Information Collaboration Hub (SAP ICH). Together, they provide a unified, enterprise-grade serialization ecosystem that enables seamless data exchange, simplified compliance, and real-time visibility across the entire supply chain. By embedding these solutions into their operations, pharmaceutical companies can not only safeguard patients but also enhance agility, strengthen global partnerships, and position themselves as innovators in a highly regulated, complex market.

Learn how leading pharmaceutical companies leverage SAP Advanced Track and Trace for Pharmaceuticals (SAP ATTP) and SAP Information Hub for Life Sciences (SAP ICH) to achieve end-to-end serialization traceability, reduce operational complexity, and drive business resilience

entry.title: Re: Access CDS Objects Exposed as SQL Services Using Microsoft SQL Server
entry.content:
Hi Roberto,
I have identified also the source of the second problem. It is been caused by a blur in the ODBC spec.

Retrieve numeric data with SQL_NUMERIC_STRUCT - ODBC API Reference | Microsoft Learn

in the code example you can find:
//NOTE: The ODBC 3.0 spec required drivers to return the sign as //1 for positive numbers and 2 for negative number. This was changed in the //ODBC 3.5 spec to return 0 for negative instead of 2.

For this reason our ODBC 3 driver used to set sign=2 for negative numbers. However MS SQL interprets those numbers as positive. Since MS SQL is the only known application using this data type for output and other applications like pyodbc also set sign=0 for negative input data of this data type I plan to change our driver behavior.
This will also require a driver code patch. Currently we plan to submit a new driver patch next week. I will send a ping when the new driver PL containing both fixes is available.
Regards
                    Frank

entry.title: SAP Build Work Zone Gets Even More Powerful with AI-Powered Capabilities
entry.content:
In today’s dynamic business environment, where speed and precision are critical to success, the ability to access, create, and act on information quickly has become a competitive advantage. That’s why we’re excited to introduce the latest AI-powered capabilities in SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition. They are designed to help your organization unlock greater productivity and smarter collaboration.  

With the addition of AI-based text generation, summarization, and comment generation, you can now accelerate content creation, quickly distill key insights from lengthy documents, and actively engage with workspace content, all directly within your digital workplace. 

As SAP Build Work Zone continues to evolve into an intelligent digital workspace, these new features bring built-in intelligence that reduces manual effort, accelerates decision-making, and enhances the overall employee experience.  

 

AI promotional model 

To help you explore these new capabilities, we’re offering them under a promotional model (totally free of charge) until December 31, 2025. During this period, each global account is entitled to 100,000 AI requests per calendar month across all instances of SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition. If the monthly quota is exceeded, users will receive a notification. The quota resets at the start of each month. 

After the promotional period ends, AI features will be available under a commercial model of SAP AI core. If you choose not to activate the commercial offering, the features will be automatically disabled. 

 

Availability 

The AI capabilities are powered by SAP AI Core and are available in the following data centers: 

  • AWS: Australia (Sydney), Brazil (São Paulo), Europe (Frankfurt), Europe (Frankfurt EU Access), Japan (Tokyo), Singapore, US East (VA) 
  • Microsoft Azure: Australia (Sydney), Europe (Netherlands), US East (VA) 
  • Google Cloud: Australia Southeast (Sydney), Europe (Frankfurt), India (Mumbai), KSA (Dammam – KSA Regulated Customers), US Central (IA) 

 

Enabling the AI features  

These AI-powered features can be enabled in the admin console. To get started, follow these simple steps: 

Step 1: Submit a Support Ticket 

Open a support ticket on component LOD-SF-SWZ requesting AI enablement for your subaccount. Make sure to include your environment details, which you can copy from the Admin Console > Overview screen using the Copy Info button. 

Step 2: Enable AI in the Admin Console 

Navigate to Administration Console > Feature Enablement > Features. Here you can select the AI features you want to activate. You’ll be prompted to review and accept the terms and conditions before proceeding. 

 

Explore the new AI features 

Once enabled using the steps above, you’ll find these capabilities integrated seamlessly into your workpages and workspace tools.  

1. AI Summarization 

This feature allows you to get the gist of long documents within seconds. AI Summarization helps you to condense large chunks of content such as wikis, blogs, workpages, and documents, into concise summaries.  

To summarize a content item, navigate to the workspace’s Content list from the navigation bar and select the document you want to process. When the content is open, click the Summarize button located at the top of the screen.  

The AI will then generate a summary that captures the key points of the original text.  

This feature supports content up to 100K words, making it a perfect tool for quickly grasping the essentials without having to read through long texts. 

2. AI Text Generation 

With this feature you can create compelling content with a few simple prompts. This feature helps you generate contextual text directly within your workpages. It is great for drafting introductions, elaborating ideas, or kickstarting any type of content. 

To use it, simply click on Add within a cell in your workspace and choose Generate Text from the dropdown menu.  

 

A dialog box will appear where you can enter your prompt. 

Based on this input, AI will generate relevant text, which may take a few moments to appear. Once the text is generated, you can further fine-tune the content to suit your style and requirements. Once you are satisfied you have the option to accept it, discard it, or generate a new version.  

3. AI Comment Generation 

Using this feature you can respond intelligently with AI-suggested comments. AI Comment Generation simplifies the process of engaging with content through contextual comments.  

To put this feature, open the Content list and select the specific content item you’d like to respond to. At the bottom of the screen, the AI icon can help you generate text with AI.  

Here you can enter a prompt or context.  

AI will then suggest relevant comment options for you to accept, discard or retry.

You can use this feature to contribute to discussions, provide feedback, or interact with colleagues. The same text generation experience is available when writing a news feed as well.

*****

entry.title: SAP S/4HANA Migration cockpit: Easier Error Handling
entry.content:
Good news 🎉 – with SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud 2508 release, working with upload files just got smoother!

📊⚠️ Get All Errors at Once - during file upload, the migration cockpit now simultaneously checks for file sanity, duplicates, and consistency. This allows all errors to be displayed at once, rather than sequentially. 

🧾🔍Error-Friendly Template - after you upload your template to the Migration Cockpit, you may encounter various errors. Previously, you had to search for these errors manually in your file. Now, you can simply download your file along with the identified errors. In the “Messages” tab, hyperlinks take you directly to the problematic cells, making corrections straightforward.

🔄📄Correction File After Simulation 
You might already be familiar with the correction file you can generate after Migration. Now you can do the same after Simulation! This gives you a focused file with only the failed records, so you can fix and move on faster.

📢All these improvements, along with new migration objects for the SAP S/4HANA 2508 Public Cloud release, are covered in the Overview Presentation – What’s New Section, which also includes high-resolution screenshots😄

entry.title: Re: Plan & Budget import financial data in Public cloud
entry.content:
Dear @Keratiya_D,

in addition to the previous answer let me point you to some additional resource, which might help you to better understand the logic during importing your file(s):

Understanding the Plan Data Scope 
This blog post explains the plan data scope with several simple examples. Example 5 is explaining how you can update or add data. And I'm wondering that data disappeared for other years then 2025, as the time dimension is mandatory for the plan data scope to exactly avoid resetting data from previous planning cycles.

Regarding BUDGET01 - project budget (and even BUDGET02 - cost center budget), please keep the following in mind:

  • Project Budget (BUDGET01) is always uploaded for the entire project and for a full year. Uploading data for specific periods or WBS Elements is not allowed. Therefore, the plan data scope must not be set for:
    PS_POSID (Work Breakdown Structure Element), 
    POPER/FISCPER (Posting Period/Fiscal Period) and 
    RBUKRS (Company Code).

  • Cost Center Budget (BUDGET02) is always uploaded for a full year. Uploading data for specific periods isn't allowed. Therefore, the plan data scope must not be set for: 
    POPER/FISCPER (Posting Period/Fiscal Period).

This should also enter your latest question:
it's not possible to update the budget by month, but you can update the full-year budget on a monthly basis.

Best regards
Susanne
